Jakob Chychrun.recovery: Chychrun may not return this season, according to Jose M. Romero of The Arizona Republic.

Lawson Crouse.recovery: Crouse broke a bone in his right hand and could miss the rest of the season, according to Arizona Coyotes insider Craig Morgan.

Clayton Keller.recovery: Keller announced he will not return this season.

Conor Timmins.recovery: Timmins has been placed on the injured reserve with a lower body injury.

Matt Grzelcyk.recovery: The Bruins announced that Grzelyck underwent a shoulder procedure and will miss approximately five months. Grzelcyk is expected to return in early November at the earliest.

Brad Marchand.recovery: The Bruins announced that Marchand underwent successful arthroscopy and labral repair on both hips and will miss approximately six months. Marchand is expected to return in late November at the earliest.

Charlie McAvoy.recovery: The Bruins announced that McAvoy underwent a shoulder procedure and will miss approximately six months. McAvoy is expected to return early December.

Jakub Zboril.recovery: The Boston Bruins placed D Jakub Zboril on Injured Reserve. Zboril underwent surgery on his ACL in December 2021. He started skating in May. Zboril is expected to participate in training camp.

Drake Caggiula.recovery: Sabres GM Kevyn Adams said Caggiula will undergo season-ending surgery. His recovery time is 6-8 months.

Sean Monahan.recovery: The Flames placed Monahan on injured reserve.

Tyler Parsons.recovery: The Calgary Flames placed G Tyler Parsons on Injured Reserve.

Frederik Andersen.recovery: Hurricanes coach Rod Brind'Amour said there's no update on Andersen's return.

Jujhar Khaira.recovery: The Blackhawks announced that Khaire underwent surgery and will be out 10-12 weeks.

Petr Mrazek.recovery: Maple Leafs coach Sheldon Keefe said Mrazek is out for a minimum of six weeks.

Joonas Korpisalo.recovery: The Blue Jackets announced that Korpisalo will undergo surgery. It is expected Korpisalo will need six months to recover (September/October).

Daniil Tarasov.recovery: Tarasov underwent season-ending surgery, according to Aaron Portzline of The Athletic.

Robby Fabbri.recovery: The Red Wings believe Fabbri tore his ACL and he's expected to miss the rest of the season. It is unsure if Fabbri will be available for the start of the 2022-23 season.

Alex Nedeljkovic.recovery: Alex Nedeljikovic left the IIHF World Championship with a lower-body injury (B. Duff - Detroit Hockey Now).

Oscar Klefbom.recovery: Klefbom will have shoulder surgery this month, according to Jason Gregor of TSN Radio. Klefbom is not expected to play this season.

Anthony Duclair.recovery: The Panthers announced that Duclair is expected to return some time mid-season of 2022-2023 after surgery to repair his Achilles.

Drew Doughty.recovery: The Kings announced that Doughty underwent wrist surgery and will miss the rest of the season.

Sean Walker.recovery: The Kings announced D Sean Walker will miss the rest of the season with a torn ACL/MCL.

Jake Allen.recovery: The Canadiens announced that Allen is dealing with a groin injury and will not play again this season.

Justin Barron.recovery: The Canadiens announced that Barron is dealing with a ankle injury and will not play again this season.

Jonathan Drouin.recovery: The Montreal Canadiens placed F Jonathan Drouin on Injured Reserve.

Jeremy Lauzon.recovery: The Predators announced that Lauzon is week-to-week.

Jonathan Bernier.recovery: The New Jersey Devils announced that G Jonathan Bernier will miss the rest of the season as he recovers from hip surgery.

Mackenzie Blackwood.recovery: The New Jersey Devils placed G Mackenzie Blackwood on Injured Reserve.

Jack Hughes.recovery: The Devils announced that Hughes will miss the rest of the season with MCL sprain on his left knee.

Jonas Siegenthaler.recovery: The Devils announced that Siegenthaler won't return this season.

Miles Wood.recovery: Devils coach Lindy Ruff said Wood has been shut down for the season.

Cal Clutterbuck.recovery: The Islanders announced that Clutterbuck will miss the rest of the season. Clutterbuck is expected to be available for the 2022-23 season opener.

Sammy Blais.recovery: The Rangers announced F Sammy Blais will miss the rest of the season with a torn ACL and his expected recovery time is 6-8 months.

Barclay Goodrow.recovery: Goodrow is week-to-week with a lower-body injury, according to Mollie Walker of the New York Post.

Connor Brown.recovery: Brown won't return this season, according to Claire Hanna of TSN.

Matt Murray.recovery: Murray is not skating and is not close to a return to action, according to report from TSN Sports in Ottawa, ON, CAN.

Shane Pinto.recovery: The Senators placed F Shane Pinto on injured reserve.

Patrick Brown.recovery: Brown is not expected to play again this season, according to Charlie O'Connor of The Athletic. Brown is expected to be rehabbing during the summer and is likely to be healthy for training camp.

Sean Couturier.recovery: The Flyers announced that Couturier had back surgery and will miss the rest of the season. Couturier is expected to be ready for the start of the 2022-23 season.

Ryan Ellis.recovery: Flyers GM Chuck Fletcher said Ellis will miss the rest of the season. Ellis is expected to be healthy for the start of training camp.

Joel Farabee.recovery: Joel Farabee is recovering from disc-replacement surgery, and it has yet to be determined if he will be available for the 2022-23 season opener.

Casey DeSmith.recovery: DeSmith will miss the rest of the playoffs after undergoing core muscle surgery according to NHL.com.

Brian Dumoulin.recovery: Dumoulin suffered a grade-3 MCL tear.

Nikolai Knyzhov.recovery: Sharks coach Bob Boughner said Knyzhov is out for the season. It is uncertain if he will be active for the 2022-23 season opener. His earliest return date is mid-October.

Kevin Labanc.recovery: Labanc won't return this season, according to Corey Masisak of The Athletic. Labanc is expected to participate in training camp.

Chris Driedger.recovery: Chris Driedger tore his right ACL during the third period of Team Canada's Gold Medal match against Finland during the IIHF World Championships. He has undergone surgery to repair the torn ACL, and he is expected to be sidelined for 7-9 months.

Brandon Tanev.recovery: The Kraken announced F Brandon Tanev will miss the rest of the season with an ACL injury. Tanev is expected to return in time for training camp (R. Clark - The Athletic).

Jordan Binnington.recovery: Binnington is expected to miss multiple weeks, according to Jeremy Rutherford of The Athletic.

Alexei Toropchenko.recovery: According to coach Doug Armstrong, Toropchenko underwent shoulder surgery and will be out until early December.

Pierre-Edouard Bellemare.recovery: Pierre-Edouard Bellemare has a meniscus injury that will need arthroscopic surgery.

Anthony Cirelli.recovery: Anthony Cirelli suffered an AC join sprain, which will require jurgery, during Game 4 of the Stanley Cup Finals (J. Smith - The Athletic).

Brayden Point.recovery: Brayden Point has a tear in his right quadricep sustained during the Eastern Conference First Round. He is expected to be fully recovered for training camp.

Nils Hoglander.recovery: The Vancouver Canucks announced that Hoglander underwent surgery and there is no timetable for his return.

Tucker Poolman.recovery: The Vancouver Canucks plaed D Tucker Poolman on long-term injureed reserve.

Laurent Brossoit.recovery: Brossoit is not close to returning, according to Jesse Granger of The Athletic.

Nicolas Hague.recovery: The Vegas Golden Knights placed D Nicolas Hague on injured reserve.

Brett Howden.recovery: The Vegas Golden Knights placed F Brett Howden on injured reserve.

Robin Lehner.recovery: Lehner had shoulder surgery. There is no timetable for his return.

Nolan Patrick.recovery: The Vegas Golden Knights placed F Nolan Patrick on the long-term injured reserve list.

Shea Weber.recovery: GM Marc Bergevin said it's unlikely that D Shea Weber plays next season and is likely to retire.

Nicklas Backstrom.recovery: Nicklas Backstrom has resurfacing surgery on his left hip in early June. There is no defined timeline for Backstrom's return.

Carl Hagelin.recovery: The Washington Capitals placed F Carl Hagelin on injured reserve. Hagelin underwent two eye surgeries in March. He was skating early May (Tarik El-Bashir - The Athletic), but his return timeline is uncertain.

Tom Wilson.recovery: The Capitals announced that Wilson underwent surgery for a torn ACL and will miss 6-8 months. Wilson is expect to return in mid-January 2023 at the earliest.
